commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level 0. Greet: - Add introductory message - Add exit message
Update UI design + Add display UI method to "Duke" class
Revert "Update UI design + Add display UI method to "Duke" class"
Update UI design + Add display UI method to "Duke" class

commitResults.messageBody:
DukeInterface.java:
- Add scanner object to read user input
- Add method "readInput" to read user input in command line
- Add method "echoInput" to echo user input from "readinput" method

Duke.java
- Updated Duke.java to use do-while loop to allow for multiple user inputs in single program execution (invokes "readInput" method from DukeInterface.java)
- Terminates Duke.java when user inputs "bye"

User can now add tasks to Duke + print all tasks added

Add Task.java class
- To describe each Task as an object
- Add method "getTaskDescription" to return Task description

Add TaskManager.java class
- To manage multiple Task objects
- Add method "addTask" to add on new Task object to Duke's Tasklist
- Add method "printTasks" to print all added Task objects to Duke's Tasklist

Update Duke.java
- Add TaskManager object
- Change do-while loop to while loop + modified loop condition

General Update
- Polish user interface + Duke's personality

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level 3. Mark as Done + Tweak code to comply with coding standards
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke.java
- Revert back to do-while loop for program execution
- Use if-else instead of switch statement to process user command
- Add additional if-else condition to check command contains "done " + invoke method "setTaskComplete" via TaskManager object

DukeInterface.java
- Modify various UI messages
- Add more functions to print various UI formats (includes emojis)

Task.java
- Add "getStatusIcon" method to mark task as done

TaskManager
- Use DukeInterface customised print methods instead of System.out.println method to display text/messages
- Tidy up code

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level 4. ToDos, Events, Deadlines + Improve Code Abstraction + Clean-up UI + TextUiTesting
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke.java
- Tokenise user input instead of manipulating user input string directly
- Revert back to switch instead of if-else to process user input
- Moved readInput() method from DukeInterface.java to Duke.java (Abstraction Improvement)
- Add ability to detect new command 'help' to print a list of all commands and its input format (print method located in DukeInterface.java)
- Add a simple check to tell user if their input is invalid and does not adhere to the fixed input format required

DukeInterface.java
- Removed readInput() method (Abstraction Improvement)
- Add new UI messages (HELP_MSG, ERROR_MSG) and their relevant print methods
- Add new method printCursor() to print arrow when pending user input
- Removed redundent print methods, such as "printLoadingMsg()" and "printSystemMsg()"
- Tidy-up UI messages in general

Task.java
- Updated getTaskDescription() method to include the status icon as well when returning the String

TaskManager.java (Main Bulk of Changes)
- Update addTask() method to check type of task (todo, deadline or event) to create the respective objects + print number of tasks currently in tasklist after adding a task
- Update printTasks() method to tell user if the list is empty
- Update setTaskComplete() method to tell user if a certain task has already been set to complete/done + print how many "tasks completed / total tasks" after setting a task complete
- Shorten all UI messages to neaten user experience + reformat how messages are displayed (in tandem with DukeInterface.java print methods)
- Add new UI messages GENERFIC_PROMPT_MSG

ToDo.java
- Newly added class that is a subclass of the class Task.java
- Add override of the method getTaskDescription of superclass Task.java to include "[T]" in addition to printing the status icon and task description

Deadline.java
- Newly added class that is a subclass of the class Task.java
- Add override of the method getTaskDescription of superclass Task.java to include "[D]" in addition to printing the status icon and task description and "(by: <date/time>)"

Event.java
- Newly added class that is a subclass of the class Task.java
- Add override of the method getTaskDescription of superclass Task.java to include "[E]" in addition to printing the status icon and task description and "(at: <date/time>)"

input.txt
- Add user-input to test UI

EXPECTED.TXT
- Add expected output after executing commands in input.txt
